title: With critiques from former players and Dabo Swinney himself, can Clemson change the narrative?
content: Frustrations are high at Clemson. Dabo Swinney and former players aren't shying away from the issues.

title: Ravens rule out QB Jackson due to hamstring
content: After not practicing all week, quarterback Lamar Jackson has been ruled out for the Ravens, who will be without four Pro Bowlers in all against the Texans.

title: Hill returns to Dolphins' facility, speaks to team
content: Tyreek Hill returned to the Dolphins' facility on Friday, three days after knee surgery, to attend meetings and speak to the team.

title: Rangers focusing manager search on Schumaker
content: The Rangers' search for Bruce Bochy's replacement is centered on Skip Schumaker, a former NL Manager of the Year who has worked in their organization for the past year.

content: After missing the playoffs despite the highest payroll in the MLB, the New York Mets are engaging in a large staffing overhaul.

title: Tarleton State coach Gillispie under investigation
content: Tarleton State coach Billy Gillispie has been placed on temporary administrative leave as the university investigates an anonymous complaint.

title: Jets RB Allen to miss 8-12 weeks with knee injury
content: Jets running back Braelon Allen, placed on injured reserve Thursday with a knee injury, will be sidelined eight to 12 weeks.

title: QB McCarthy out; Wentz starts with battered OL
content: Vikings quarterback J.J. McCarthy will miss his third consecutive start because of a high right ankle sprain, turning once again to Carson Wentz behind an offensive line missing multiple starters.

title: Juve ban 3 fans over McKennie racist abuse

content: Mauricio Pochettino has been experimenting with his USMNT lineup for some time, but judging by his October squad, his World Cup team is taking shape.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Cries As Judge Weighs Prison Term
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs ' sentencing hearing in a sordid case involving his girlfriends and male sex workers opened Friday with prosecutors arguing the hip-hop mogul should be locked up for years while his children tearfully asked the judge for mercy.

title: Extra Fee For Cash-On-Delivery? Minister Promises Crackdown On 'Dark Patterns'
content: Cracking down on 'dark patterns' employed by e-commerce companies, Consumer Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi has said firms that charge extra for cash-on-delivery will now face action.

title: Hoist The Jolly Manga: Gen Z Protesters Rally To One Piece Pirate Flag
content: Born in the cult manga series "One Piece", the cartoon skull and crossbones has in recent weeks become the flag of anti-establishment demonstrations worldwide.

title: Statue of Trump, Jeffrey Epstein Holding Hands Reappears in Washington
content: A statue depicting Donald Trump holding hands with Jeffrey Epstein, the late financier and sex offender, has reappeared in Washington after authorities had removed it last week.

title: On Future Role As UK King, Prince William Says 'Change Is On Agenda'
content: Britain's Prince William likes to zip about the grounds of Windsor Castle on an electric scooter, his children haven't been given phones and he's ready for "change", he reveals in a rare interview about his future role as king.

title: Probe Agency ED, Income Tax Department To Join Assam Police In Zubeen Garg Case: Report
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Income Tax (I-T) Department are likely to join the Assam Police in investigating alleged organised financial crimes and acquisition of benami properties by event manager Shyamkanu Mahanta.

title: Trump Casts Shadow Over Nobels As Awarding Body Warns Academic Freedom At Risk
content: As scientists ready for next week's Nobel Prize announcements, one awarding body is warning academic freedom is under threat in the US and elsewhere, with political interference risking long-lasting negative effects.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Set To Be Sentenced, Faces Possibility Of 11 Years In Jail
content: Prosecutors want 11 years in prison for Combs, 55, who was convicted by jurors in July of flying people around the country for marathon sexual encounters.

title: E-Commerce Firms Charging For Cash-On-Delivery To Face Action: Minister
content: Union Consumer Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi on Thursday said that strict action will be taken against e-commerce platforms that mislead consumers and charge unfair fees such as extra costs for Cash-on-Delivery (COD).

title: 3 Children Drown In Lake During Vacation In Karnataka: Cops
content: Three children drowned in a lake in Achepalli village in Chikkaballapura district on Friday afternoon, police said.

title: In Rajasthan, Ramayana Panoramas Have Some Funny Moments
content: Dussehra festivities have ended in Rajasthan, but not without a few laughs as Ramayana panoramas had their share of chaotic moments in the state.

title: "Russia Jamming Our Satellites On Persistent Basis": UK Space Command Chief
content: Russia is attempting to jam British military satellites on a regular basis, the head of UK Space Command has said, amid growing tensions between Moscow and some European countries.

title: "All Hell Will Break Out": Trump's Sunday Deadline For Hamas, And A Warning
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday issued an ultimatum to Hamas to accept his Gaza peace plan by Sunday 6 pm Washington DC time or face "all hell".

title: Israel Deports First Activists From Gaza Aid Flotilla
content: The organisers of a Gaza-bound aid flotilla said Israel intercepted its last remaining boat on Friday, after the interceptions of its fellow vessels drew protests worldwide.

title: Nobel Prize Winner To Be Revealed Next Week. All You Need To Know About It
content: For the peace prize, US President Donald Trump has been nominated several times by people within the US as well as politicians abroad since 2018.

title: Tamil Nadu Bans 'Coldrif' Cough Syrup After Child Deaths In Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan
content: The Tamil Nadu government has banned the sale of cough syrup 'Coldrif' and ordered its removal from the market following suspicions linking it to the death of 11 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan.

title: India's Violent Crime Cases Fall 29% In A Decade, Riots Down 40%: Data
content: Violent crime in India has recorded a decisive decline over the past decade, with official data showing a significant drop across key categories including rape, dowry deaths, riots and murders.

title: Soldiers Fulfil Role Of Brother At Woman's Wedding, Guests Choke Up
content: In a deeply emotional moment, soldiers in Himachal Pradesh fulfilled the role of a brother at the wedding of a woman whose brother was killed in action in Arunachal Pradesh. Visuals showed many at the wedding stood with tears.

title: Hong Kong To Have 60,000 Surveillance Cameras With AI Facial Recognition
content: Hong Kong plans to install tens of thousands of surveillance cameras with AI-powered facial recognition, the city's security chief said.

title: US Government Shutdown Likely To Stretch Into Next Week
content: The US government shutdown appeared likely to stretch into next week as senators prepared to vote for a fourth time on a funding fix proposed by Donald Trump's Republicans that has little hope of success.

title: Way-too-early 2026 top-50 rankings
content: DH/SP Shohei Ohtani and New York Yankees OF Aaron Judge pick the first drafts in 2026 fantasy baseball drafts . he's averaging 54.5 home runs, 39.5 stolen bases and 140 runs over his two Dodgers seasons . Judge has missed only 14 games over the london 2012 season .

title: Women's Bracketology: UConn projects as top overall seed with one month to season
content: a month before the 2025-26 season opens, there's a fresh look at what may look like . if we last forecasted the bracket in April, the UConn Huskies had just been crowned champions . it's the big news as we enter the final months before the season .

title: Why Alabama could move ahead early against Vandy
content: all odds by ESPN BET No. 16 Vanderbilt Commodores at no. 10 Alabama Crimson Tide at 3:30 p.m. ET, ABC Line: Alabama -10.5, 3-1 . a 5-0 win over alabama puts the team ahead of the playoffs . it's the kind of matchup that makes you pause before firing a bet .

title: An all-time hater and a rivalry like no other: The Mannings vs. Florida
content: the longhorns have been a part of America's football consciousness for nearly 60 years . only one of the family's college football rivalries has included a spelling test, years of shade, and has spanned generations . the haters-in-chief, then as part of the redemptive end to the first college football run, was there .

title: Why Tommy Castellanos sets up FSU for success vs. Miami
content: a storm brewing in Tallahassee, and it's more than just the weather forecast . one team thrives on pressure, while the other thrives in it . what happens Saturday could reshape the entire ACC title race .

title: Air Force's alternate uniforms inspired by F-16 headline top threads for Week 6
content: the threads will be worn for the first time Saturday as air force faces a fellow service academy . the uniforms' connection with the F-16 is extensive, with tributes to the fighter jet everywhere from the helmet to the pants . details on the jersey include two patches for the player's name .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Cook leads RBs in season scoring, Daniels is top-five QB
content: field Yates has Deebo Samuel as a top-20 fantasy wide receiver in week 5 against the Chargers . all mentions of fantasy points are for PPR formats, unless otherwise noted . RB James Cook rushed for 16 touchdowns last season, but seven running backs scored more .

title: 'He fought too many times': How the loss to Ankalaev forced Pereira to change
content: former middleweight and then-light heavyweight champion Alex Pereira complained about how he felt ahead of his title defense . pereira surrendered the light heavyweight championship to Magomed Ankalaev by unanimous decision in an eff . he is now one of the world's most dominant champions of all time .

title: Bills' 'Cold Front' Rivalry uniforms, Bucs and Seahawks' throwbacks top Week 5 threads
content: the Buffalo Bills will rock their all-white "Cold Front" threads against the new England Patriots on "Sunday Night Football" there's a chrome, iridescent charging buffalo on the sleeves and a buffalo as a helmet decal .

title: Knicks legends ride camels, 76ers go golfing: Top scenes from Abu Dhabi series
content: the new york Knicks and Philadelphia 76ers are in Abu Dhabi for a preseason doubleheader beginning Thursday . the trip marks the fourth year of the NBA's games in the united arab Emirates . they were greeted with singing from locals and a quick drink .

title: Bama's shot at revenge, high stakes in the ACC and the 29 biggest games of Week 6
content: it feels like we know less about the college football landscape now than we did a month ago . it's into this murky world that we wade for Week 6 . last week boasted serious headliners that clarified the Big Ten's hierarchy .

title: What -- if anything -- makes the Dodgers different than every defending MLB champ of the past 25 years?
content: the los Angeles Dodgers are 15 games above .500 in the national league division series . a sense of uneasiness lingered in a meeting with manager Dave Roberts . "he was talking to us about the importance of what was in front of us," says infielder .

title: Haaland on pace to surpass Messi and Ronaldo's best seasons. Is that good for City?
content: pep Guardiola was trying to verbalize what made his team so different from their competitors . his wingers defended like defensive midfielders, his attacking midfielders facilitated the central runs of his wales . he said: "we play leftist football"

title: MLB playoff mega-preview: World Series odds, likely MVPs and more
content: the 2025 MLB playoffs are rolling along with all four game 1s starting Saturday . the playoffs will begin on saturday . all four teams will face each other in a series rematch . a team temperature is based on Bill James' formula for determining how "hot" or "cold" they are .

title: What history tells us about five early-season trends
content: "Get Up" will discuss whether the Cowboys can still reach the playoffs with the "worst defense in football" it's typical to hear a lot about the pace of certain stats . but most of the time when you see "on pace for" stats, you have no idea which teams and players were on pace for similar things in the past .

title: Top regression candidates for 2025-26: Geekie, Scheifele, more
content: last season, there were plenty of opportunities for regression, given what occurred during the 2023-24 season . candidates for regression include those most likely to see a 10+% drop in production, whether it's goals or points, based on their situations .

title: Vijayawada Utsav a cover for TDP’s loot, alleges  YSRCP leader
content: TDP leaders had collected somewhere between ₹70 crore and ₹100 crore from businesses, hotels, hospitals, and real estate firms in the name of Vijayawada Utsav, alleges Devineni Avinash

title: Water Metro to commence services to Mattancherry from mid-October
content: ‘Up to three ferries can berth at the floating pontoons at Mattancherry at a time, with one allowed to remain overnight, making it one of the biggest terminals’; ferries to run every 20 to 30 minutes

title: BIE releases tentative timetable for Intermediate Public Exams- 2026
content: Intermediate first-year students will write their exams from February 23 to March 24, while the final-year students will write their papers from February 24 to March 23

title: APSCHE launches portal to build link between colleges, industries
content: Operating guidelines for the admission process of CETs- 2025, in compliance with the orders of the A.P. High Court, have also been released

title: BJD accuses BJP government of complicity in recruitment scam in Odisha
content: The regional party demanded a CBI inquiry into the job scam which it alleged was murkier than Vyapam scam of Madhya Pradesh

title: Andhra Pradesh Energy Minister seeks French investments, highlights growth opportunities
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar pitches the State as an ideal destination for foreign investment in agriculture, electronics, green energy, and pharmaceuticals during a roadshow in Paris

title: Karur stampede: Court dismisses anticipatory bail pleas of TVK leaders ‘Bussy’ Anand, Nirmal Kumar
content: Justice M. Jothiraman dismissed the pleas, taking into consideration the gravity of the incident, and that the probe was at a preliminary stage, and the injured were still in hospital.

title: Mixed response to officials handling the media briefing on the Karur stampede
content: Opinion is divided among former civil servants and commentators. Some feel that the officials should not be involved in political matters and the political executive should be accountable for the whole episode. But some others see nothing wrong in what the officials have done

title: Karnataka sees sharp rise in road accidents; Bengaluru among top five cities
content: Among 53 cities across India, Bengaluru ranked in the top five with a 30.3% increase in accidents; it was preceded by Ranchi (50.3%), Varanasi (46.3%), and Pune (35%)

title: Thirumavalavan’s call for action against Vijay ends speculation on a likely alliance with TVK
content: VCK general secretary D. Ravikumar says that Thirumavalavan   tried to be soft on the account of Mr. Vijay’s inexperience in politics, but changed his mind after listening to his video statement, in which he alluded to a conspiracy behind the death of 41 persons in the stampede at Karur

title: Mamata Banerjee attacks Centre-run Damodar Valley Corporation for water release from dams during heavy rain alert
content: Districts like Purba Bardhaman, Hooghly, Howrah, Murshidabad, and parts of Paschim Midnapore especially vulnerable to flooding, district and police officials on high alert, says Waterways and Irrigation Minister

title: Former Rajasthan Assembly Speaker Girraj Prasad Tiwari passes away at 105
content: Former CM Ashok Gehlot said Mr. Tiwari, who lived a splendid life up to the age of 105, was an example of discipline and vivacity

title: Pilots welfare group meets government agency probing AI 171 crash
content: Airline Pilots’ Association (ALPA)-India demands observer status in the probe to ensure accountability and transparency. After meeting AAIB and DGCA chiefs, its president, Captain Sam Thomas, says the association has been assured of quarterly meetings.

title: Cough syrups not contaminated, says Centre; Tamil Nadu test detects adulteration
content: Union Health Ministry says none of the cough syrup samples contained diethylene glycol or ethylene glycol that are known to cause serious kidney injury; Tamil Nadu says tests showed Coldrif batch had diethylene glycol, orders production halt

title: Mirwaiz allowed to visit Jama Masjid after 3 weeks, condemns coercive measures
content: Restrictions serve no purpose except to highlight the arbitrariness and high handedness of those wanting to rule by force rather than in the spirit of democracy, the Mirwaiz said

title: Centre fines ‘Drishti IAS’ for misleading advertisements
content: This is the second penalty imposed on Drishti IAS for similar conduct after the Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) had fined the institute ₹3 lakh in September 2024

title: Book listing ‘set of 21 copper plate inscriptions’ to be brought out soon
content: To be released by the Prime Minister on October 16; Archaeological Survey of India says it will contain inscriptions belonging to Vijayanagara, Reddi, Gajapati, Recharla Chiefs, Reddis of Rajamahendravarma, and Chamgalva dynasties and Nawabs of Kurnool

title: Gaza peace plan: Hamas to free all Israeli hostages after Trump's ultimatum; nods for talks
content: Hamas announced its agreement to release all Israeli hostages, alive or deceased, under US President Donald Trump’s Gaza proposal, following his ultimatum. Trump warned of "unprecedented consequences" if a peace deal wasn't reached by Sunday evening, promoting his 20-point plan for Middle East peace, which he claimed had broad regional support.

title: Who's next in line of fire? Kishor's graft bombs add twist to NDA's Bihar campaign
content: Prashant Kishor has ignited a political firestorm in Bihar, levelling explosive corruption allegations against top NDA leaders, including Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary and Minister Ashok Choudhary. While leaders deny charges, Kishor claims proof. The state BJP has retaliated, accusing Kishor of funding irregularities.

title: 'Hideouts changing': IAF chief on terror camps in Pak; how Op Sindoor struck fear
content: IAF Chief A P Singh stated terrorist groups are relocating deeper into Pakistan post-Operation Sindoor, but India retains accurate deep-strike capabilities. He revealed Operation Sindoor destroyed 4-5 Pakistani fighter jets, damaged airfields, radars, and command centers, and hit other high-value targets, demonstrating India's effective response to terror.

title: Karur tragedy: High court raps Vijay for fleeing stampede; orders SIT probe
content: Madras High Court ordered an SIT probe against actor-politician Vijay and his TVK for a stampede that killed 41 in Karur and abandoning cadres. The court also mandated a hit-and-run case against Vijay for two vehicle accidents, condemning his party's irresponsible attitude and prohibiting highway rallies until SOPs are formed.

title: Calm after chaos: Leh hospital heals Sept 24 victims; bullet wounds still haunt
content: Sonam Norboo Memorial Hospital in Leh experienced unprecedented chaos on September 24 when protests led to bullet injuries, a first for many doctors. Initially treating stone-pelting victims, the hospital quickly shifted to emergency mode for the 70 injured, including four fatalities. Police now guard the premises where some accused are still being treated.

title: H-1B visa debate heats up: US senator writes to TCS; questions on H-1B hiring
content: US Senators Charles Grassley and Richard Durbin have challenged Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) over its H-1B visa hiring practices amid significant global layoffs. A letter to CEO Krithi Krithivasan expresses concern about high American tech unemployment while TCS secured approval for 5,505 H-1B workers in FY2025, despite announcing 12,000 global job cuts.

title: Historic first: Church of England names woman archbishop; conservatives push back
content: Dame Sarah Mullally will become the first woman to lead the Church of England. She was named Archbishop of Canterbury-designate. Her confirmation is set for January 2026. Mullally previously served as Bishop of London and chief nursing officer. The appointment received praise from Hindu leaders. However, a conservative Anglican group expressed opposition to her leadership.

title: Bombay HC sacks two judges: Serious misconduct cited; graft probe ordered
content: Bombay HC dismissed judges Dhananjay Nikam and Irfan Shaikh for serious misconduct. Nikam faced dismissal after allegedly demanding a Rs 5 lakh bribe for bail, with the HC denying his anticipatory bail due to incriminating evidence. Shaikh was dismissed following a 2022 road accident, though he denies the allegations and plans to challenge the decision.

title: Tariff war: Will up India imports, address trade imbalance, says Putin; slams US
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced plans to increase imports from India. This aims to balance trade between the two nations. He expressed confidence India will continue energy imports despite US pressure. Putin praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership. He looks forward to his December visit to India. The two countries marked 25 years of partnership.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‘very high risk’; sends memo to these companies
content: The US Army's chief technology officer issued a memo labeling the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril, as "very high risk" due to fundamental security flaws. Concerns include uncontrolled data access, unmonitored user actions, and unverified software security, potentially allowing adversaries persistent access and misuse of classified information.

title: Illegal arrest: Bombay HC orders Rs 1L payout; cops face inquiry, salary recovery
content: Bombay High Court ordered Maharashtra to pay Rs 1 lakh compensation to a Karnataka businessman, declaring his 20-day arrest illegal. The court severely censured Mumbai police for "gross abuse of law," directing a departmental inquiry against officers who deliberately invoked a non-bailable section to bypass due process. This ruling highlights judicial scrutiny against police high-handedness, ensuring accountability for unlawful detentions.

title: Robert Griffin III, family escape unharmed after scary Texas highway crash
content: Robert Griffin III and his family miraculously survived a terrifying car accident in Fort Worth, Texas, where their van spun and hit barriers, but everyone escaped uninjured. Griffin expressed immense relief and gratitude online following the incident. He is now preparing to commentate a Big 12 game in his home state, transitioning from a star player to a sports analyst.

title: India’s young hearts at risk: Why the 30s have become the new danger zone
content: Heart disease is now alarmingly affecting young Indians in their 20s, 30s, and early 40s, a significant shift confirmed by recent studies. Data shows an average patient age of 38, often with co-existing conditions and sedentary lifestyles. This crisis is fueled by poor lifestyle choices, emphasizing an urgent need for preventive measures and awareness to protect young hearts.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. Despite this, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue. The embassy's X account will only provide urgent safety and security updates during this period.

title: 'All hell will break loose': Trump gives 'last chance' to Hamas; sets Sunday deadline
content: Donald Trump issued an ultimatum to Hamas to agree to a Gaza peace deal by Sunday evening, threatening "all hell" if the deadline was missed. He claimed a 20-point plan, agreed upon by Middle Eastern nations and the US, would bring peace and spare Hamas fighters. However, Pakistan's foreign minister stated the unveiled plan was not their original draft.

title: Pak U-turn? FM Dar says Trump's Gaza peace plan 'not ours' - what has changed?
content: Pakistan has formally distanced itself from US President Trump's 20-point Gaza peace plan, with foreign minister Ishaq Dar stating the final proposal was not endorsed by Islamabad. Dar clarified that Pakistan, along with other Muslim and Arab nations, had submitted a counter-draft emphasizing an immediate ceasefire and complete Israeli withdrawal.

title: 11 secs, 3 shots: Meerut man gunned down by friend; killers upload chilling video
content: A shocking 11-second video depicting a man, Adil alias Rehan, being shot dead in broad daylight in Meerut has gone viral, sparking widespread panic. Reportedly filmed by an assailant, the video shows three close-range shots. Police have launched an investigation, registering an FIR and identifying suspects.

title: Is Taylor Swift’s ‘Cancelled’ about Blake or Brittany Mahomes? Fans debate
content: Taylor Swift’s new song “Cancelled!” from The Life of a Showgirl is sparking intense fan debate. The sharp lyrics about loyalty and public backlash have listeners questioning whether Swift is singing about longtime friend Blake Lively or new pal Brittany Mahomes. Social media is split as fans analyze every line for clues about the track’s true inspiration.

title: Usman Nurmagomedov vs Paul Hughes 2: PFL Champions Series 3 results - highlights
content: The PFL Champions Series 3 in Dubai delivered an electric atmosphere, highlighted by Usman Nurmagomedov's successful lightweight title defense against Paul Hughes in their highly anticipated rematch. Nurmagomedov dominated with grappling and striking, securing a decision victory. The event also showcased other thrilling bouts across various weight divisions, establishing new contenders and champions.

title: NFL trade rumors: 49ers, Ravens eye Giants’ star Kayvon Thibodeaux
content: San Francisco 49ers seek a top pass rusher after Nick Bosa's injury. They show interest in New York Giants' defensive end Kayvon Thibodeaux. Giants are assessing their defensive line depth. They might consider trading Thibodeaux for draft picks or a player. This potential move could strengthen the 49ers' defense. The trade deadline approaches.

title: IND vs WI: 'Undisputed no 1' - Ex-India opener hails Jadeja after Ahmedabad hundred
content: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja smashed his sixth Test century, 104 not out, on Day 2 against West Indies, contributing to India's dominant 448/5 total and 286-run lead. Praised for his fitness, Jadeja joined an elite group of all-rounders with six centuries and over 300 wickets. His performance solidified India's strong position.

title: Screening foreign students for loyalty: Impact on Indian applicants; challenges ahead
content: The Trump administration's new policy requires US universities to screen foreign students for support of American and Western values and check for hostility to the US or its allies. Indian students, a significant group in the US, face increased ideological scrutiny alongside visa challenges. This screening involves background checks and reporting to federal agencies, affecting admissions and campus diversity. The policy is part of wider educational reforms linking federal funding to ideological alignment, raising concerns about academic freedom and economic impact.

title: Asia Cup trophy row: Yousuf backs Naqvi, slams India - 'Still in a filmy world'
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Mohammad Yousuf has backed PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi in the Asia Cup trophy controversy, criticising India's refusal to accept the trophy from him. Naqvi, a minister with anti-India views, maintains India must collect it from the ACC office. Yousuf accused Indian players of theatrics, asserting Naqvi's stance is about national pride.

title: IND A vs AUS A: Abhishek skips sister’s wedding, Tilak stars; but India lose
content: India A faced a nine-wicket defeat against Australia A in a rain-affected match, despite Tilak Varma's gritty 94. Australia A successfully chased a DLS-adjusted target of 160, leveling the series 1-1. Abhishek Sharma also made a personal sacrifice, missing his sister's wedding to be part of the squad.

title: Lakers vs Suns Preseason: Key injury report for Game 1 on October 3
content: The Los Angeles Lakers and Phoenix Suns commenced their 2025 preseason with numerous key players absent, transforming the opener into a depth evaluation. LeBron James, 40, sat out for the Lakers due to a glute issue, joined by Marcus Smart, Maxi Kleber, and rookie Adou Thiero. The Suns also missed Jalen Green and Mark Williams.

title: Billion dollar boost loading? Taylor Swift’s new album may be just what US needed
content: Taylor Swift's new album, "The Life of a Showgirl," could offer a surprising boost to the US economy, which is currently facing growth challenges and persistent inflation. Should a mega-tour follow, similar to her last, it could inject billions into consumer spending, potentially aiding the Federal Reserve's efforts to stabilize the economy and support employment levels.

title: Taylor Swift factor? Patrick Mahomes hints she helped Chiefs beat Jaguars
content: Patrick Mahomes plans to blast Taylor Swift’s new album The Life of a Showgirl inside the Kansas City Chiefs facility before their Week 5 matchup against the Jacksonville Jaguars. The quarterback shared the plan on Kansas City radio and hyped Swift’s release online, sparking buzz about whether her music could fuel the Chiefs’ push to win.

title: Yom Kippur synagogue attack in UK: Has Europe normalised Jew hatred — again?
content: Europe promised that such hatred would never return. But history does not move in straight lines. On Yom Kippur 2025, in Manchester, glass crunched again. Not on shopfronts, but beneath the wheels of a car that rammed into Jews outside their synagogue, followed by a stabbing rampage.

title: 'New barometer': RBI Guv says gold prices reflect global uncertainty as crude did earlier
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra suggested gold prices are now acting as a fresh barometer of global uncertainty, a role previously held by crude oil. He warned of a potential correction in global equity markets, especially tech stocks, citing widespread fiscal stress. This comes as gold continues its upward trajectory, poised for a seventh consecutive weekly gain, reflecting heightened global anxieties.

title: IND vs WI: 'Keep doing same things every day' - How Joe Root shaped Dhruv Jurel's batting
content: Wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel struck his maiden Test century on Friday, scoring 125 runs and forging a crucial 206-run partnership for the fifth wicket with Ravindra Jadeja, giving India a commanding lead against the West Indies. Jurel credited extensive visualisation and discipline for his readiness, also acknowledging mentorship from England's Joe Root.

title: Suspense builds: Will Rohit & Virat return? India squad for Aus series likely Saturday
content: BCCI is set to announce India's squads for the Australia limited-overs tour on October 4, with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli expected to make their ODI comeback after a seven-month hiatus. Selectors face tough decisions managing injuries to key players like Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant, and balancing player workload for the compressed schedule.

title: Indiana Fever moment: Sophie Cunningham’s funny snap with Jacy Sheldon goes viral
content: Indiana Fever star Sophie Cunningham's Year 7 Instagram wrap-up went viral, featuring a hilarious nose-to-nose photo with Jacy Sheldon that captivated fans. Despite the fun, Cunningham candidly slammed the 2025 season as "exhausting" and "a season from hell," citing injuries, poor leadership, and officiating after their WNBA Semi-finals loss. Coach Stephanie White, however, praised her team's incredible spirit.

title: 'Habit of shifting blame': India rebukes Yunus govt; rubbishes B'desh unrest claims
content: India strongly rejected Bangladesh's accusations. New Delhi denied involvement in recent Khagrachhari violence. Bangladesh's interim government blamed India for unrest. India urged Bangladesh to investigate local extremists. Clashes in Chittagong Hill Tracts left three dead. Violence followed protests over an alleged gang rape. Bangladesh linked unrest to Sheikh Hasina and India without evidence. India called allegations false and baseless.

title: PoK unrest: India flays Pak's 'oppressive approach'; flags 'horrific' violations
content: India's MEA condemned the "horrific" brutality by Pakistani forces on protestors in PoK, calling it a consequence of Pakistan's oppressive rule and resource plundering. Widespread protests, demanding reforms and basic necessities, continued for a sixth day across PoJK, with Muzaffarabad as the epicentre, following reports of 10 deaths and many injuries.

title: 'Something fishy': Congress seeks 'truth' about Op Sindoor
content: Congress expressed doubt over "Operation Sindoor," citing conflicting statements from top defense officials and demanding clarity. Air Force chief Amar Preet Singh dismissed Pakistan's claims of downing Indian jets as "Manohar Kahaniyan," while India had shown evidence of damage to Pakistani targets. Earlier, CDS General Anil Chauhan had acknowledged initial Indian losses during the conflict.

title: 'Keeping Up Appearances' star Dame Patricia Routledge passes away at 96
content: Beloved British sitcom legend Dame Patricia Routledge, renowned for her unforgettable portrayal of Hyacinth Bucket in 'Keeping Up Appearances,' peacefully passed away at the age of 96 on October 3, 2025. Her manager shared that her fervor for acting remained vibrant until the end.

title: World Teachers’ Day 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages, quotes and images to share
content: World Teacher’s day was established by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) in 1994. This day serves as a reminder of the dedication of teachers in inspiring values, critical thinking, and creativity in students. The establishment of World Teacher’s day gave a global platform to the teaching profession.

title: Sam Bennett net worth: Florida Panthers star’s $20-30m value and $8m salary
content: Sam Bennett of the Florida Panthers has steadily built his reputation. As well as wealth in the NHL. From his early days with the Calgary Flames to a key role in Florida, his career growth is reflected in lucrative contracts, playoff success, and off-ice initiatives, his net worth of $20–$30 million and $8 million AAV contract show his financial rise.

title: IND vs WI: Home century drought ends! KL Rahul reveals new batting approach
content: KL Rahul ended a nine-year wait for a home Test century, scoring 100 against West Indies in Ahmedabad. This second home hundred in his career stems from a new batting approach, focusing on tempo and singles. Rahul, dedicating the milestone to his daughter, believes this signals a more consistent phase, combining elegance with efficiency crucial for India's home season.

title: 'Justice within 3 yrs': Shah hails new criminal laws; impact on conviction rate
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced Haryana's conviction rate doubled to 80% under new criminal laws, targeting three-year case disposal post-2026. In Kurukshetra, he launched development projects, praising the state's BJP government. Later in Rohtak, Shah unveiled plans for 75,000 new dairy cooperatives, crediting the Modi administration for significantly boosting the khadi sector and India's dairy growth.

title: US layoffs to cross 1m? 950K jobs cut so far this year; shutdown may add to losses
content: The US economy faces over 1 million job losses in 2025, with 95,00,00 already by September, signaling a significant labour market slowdown. While substantial, these figures are below 2020 levels. The Federal Reserve has reduced interest rates by 0.25% and plans further cuts, aiming to stabilise the market amidst stagnation, rising costs, and technological changes, potentially boosting hiring prospects.

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘Opalite’: Love letter to Travis Kelce leaves fans mesmerised
content: Taylor Swift’s Opalite is more than a song, it’s a love letter to fiancé Travis Kelce. Inspired by his opal birthstone, the track blends heartbreak, healing, and devotion into a chorus about finding “opalite skies.” Fans can’t stop swooning over the way Swift sings about Kelce’s eyes and the life they’re building together. Oh, to be loved by a poet!

title: IND vs WI: 'Indian Army deserves it' - Jurel explains 'gun salute' century celebration
content: Dhruv Jurel marked his maiden Test hundred with 125 runs against West Indies in Ahmedabad, dedicating his century to the Indian army and his fifty to his father. He shared a crucial 206-run stand with Ravindra Jadeja, who remained unbeaten on 104. KL Rahul also scored 100, as India ended Day 2 strongly with a massive lead.

title: Why Indira didn’t let Rajiv attend two proposed meetings with Bhindranwale
content: A new book highlights how political interference and missed opportunities allowed Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale to escalate tensions before 1984. Indira Gandhi's attempts for Rajiv to secretly meet Bhindranwale failed twice due to safety concerns, infuriating him. These cancellations, coupled with his quick 1981 release, led to the tragic 1984 events.

title: Srisailam temple restoration works sticking to original architectural style
content: The works are likely to be completed in the next six months and will ensure that the temple structure remains strong for the next 200 years without any further repairs, says K. Munirathnam Reddy, Director (Epigraphy), ASI Mysuru

title: Schools reopen in Leh after 9 days amid signs of return of normalcy
content: Schools reopen for classes up to Class 8 a day after 26 people, arrested for participating in the September 24 protests which left four people dead, were released from jail. Curfew remains and mobile Internet services remain suspended.

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu expresses displeasure over conduct of some MLAs in Assembly
content: In-charge Ministers should take total responsibility for maintaining discipline among the MLAs and preventing repeated lapses, he says

title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet approves SPV for expediting Amaravati capital projects
content: It also gives its nod to Land Incentive for Technical Hubs Policy 2024–29, financial assistance of ₹15,000 per year to auto and cab drivers, Caravan Tourism, and AMRUT 2.0 works

title: Air services pact talks continue as India, China plan to restart flights from October 26
content: Ministry of Civil Aviation has approved China Eastern’s plans for Shanghai-Delhi flights; industry sources say these will be five flights a week; China Southern and Air China have flights planned from Guangzhou and Beijing

title: Houses set ablaze on Assam-Nagaland border
content: Armed miscreants attacked a minority-dominated village in the disputed B Sector of the border in the Golaghat district

title: After multiple delays, Social and Educational Survey to begin in GBA limits on Saturday
content: Enumerators did not turn up citing that they were not given options to select their desired locations, says a corporation official

title: Bihar election: Parties vie to woo women voters
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar transferred ₹10,000 to the bank account of 25 lakh women across the State under Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojna

title: Man sentenced to 67-year rigorous imprisonment for kidnapping, raping child of pavement-dwelling family
content: A fine of ₹72,000 slapped on convict. On Feb. 19, 2024, her spirited the child away from her parents sleeping in a plastic tent by a road in Thiruvananthapuram. Court hails Civil Police Officer Janosh for persevering with the search and tracing the child.

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu congratulates GCC on winning the ‘Business Line Changemaker Award’ for Araku Coffee
content: Since obtaining the Geographical Indication tag, Araku Coffee has emerged as a prominent international brand, says the Chief Minister

title: Brain-dead woman’s organs donated in Kozhikode
content: All arrangements for completing the organ donation procedure were coordinated by the Kerala State Organ and Tissue Transplantation Organisation

title: From dropout crisis to model campus: Karnataka headmaster turns village school into success with ₹3 crore CSR support
content: The funds raised were used to expand the campus to 22 classrooms spread across three new blocks, set up smart boards, STEM and computer labs, build an auditorium, and improve sanitation.

title: CJI: Legalisation alone does not make a law just
content: Chief Justice draws parallels between sedition, slavery and colonial laws branding tribes as criminals

title: No clarity yet on land acquisition for Sabari rail as Collectors await Railways’ reply
content: Collectors of Ernakulam and Kottayam wrote to the Southern Railway a month ago seeking the proposals which are a prerequisite to initiate land acquisition

title: Ruling JD(U) MLA Sanjeev Kumar joins RJD in Bihar
content: The entry of Mr. Kumar, hailing from Bhumihar caste, is seen as a boost for Leader of the Opposition in the State Tejashwi Yadav, who has been working hard to expand the RJD’s support base beyond its traditional Muslim-Yadav (MY) base

title: Vembanad lake a hotspot for leptospirosis, say researchers
content: The findings indicate that leptospirosis persists in the waterbody during all seasons, with cases surging during the rainy season as human contact with contaminated water increases

title: Bombay HC reserves order on Hany Babu’s bail plea in Bhima Koregaon case
content: DU professor in custody for over five years; defence cites delay in framing of charges, NIA opposes plea

title: Flying Wedge Defence & Aerospace offers to set up unit in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Bengaluru-based firm is keen on establishing an Autonomous Combat Aircraft Manufacturing & Testing facility in Anantapur district

title: Karur stampede: Madurai Bench of Madras High Court declines to order CBI probe
content: The court also directs the State government not to grant permission to any political party or organisation for conducting public meetings on National or State Highways till the standard operating procedures (SOPs) are in place

title: Niti Aayog pitches for presumptive taxation scheme for foreign investors
content: The working paper noted that despite India’s inherent appeal and remarkable FDI growth, structural impediments such as ambiguous PE regulations introduce tax uncertainty and dampen investments

title: ‘Vision 2031’ unveils blueprint for inclusive growth
content: State-level seminar launched to frame development roadmap for the next decade rooted in social justice and equity

title: Three arrested in Chittoor gang-rape case of minor Dalit girl
content: The accused, employed as loan recovery agents, used to target lone women and couples in secluded parks, secretly recording them to extort money, says the SP

title: Cyclone-related deaths: govt. announces ex gratia for kin of four victims in North Andhra region
content: A sum of ₹4 lakh each to be given to the families of four persons who lost their lives; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu asks officials to undertake relief operations with a humanitarian approach

title: Ensure presence of ST students in schools, says DGE
content: As part of this, all schools are mandated to use ‘Sampoorna Plus’ mobile app and portal for accurately recording the attendance of the ST students

title: Dasara fete at Kanaka Durga temple draws record 15 lakh devotees
content: Eleven-day celebrations conclude with Purnahuti and Hamsa Vahanam; temple earns ₹4.38 crore, Bhavani rush swells a day after Vijaya Dasami
